result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C Hallio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Hallio

defendant.name: Hallio, Joseph C

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing 04/08/2015 PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: DNA expungement language correction to sentencing April 8, 2015.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 3.  Defendant Joseph C Hallio in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Joseph C Hallio in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 73 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0
DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  Conditions of extended supervision:

AS TO EACH COUNT:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Keisha W.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision. 

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment; 
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Joseph C Hallio not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court feels bail is appropriately set.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests case set for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/8/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Joseph C Hallio in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Joseph C Hallio in custody.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph C Hallio in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Joseph C Hallio in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case adjourned Preliminary Hearing February 5, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
